39167915.review:
Well, after reading all the praise in comments/reviews I expected much more..
So, here what you get: pretty basic yet sufficient game mechanics, lively characters, not mind-blowing but pretty entertaining dialogues, about 4-6 hours of gameplay. 
Conclusion: decent game for its price, just don't expect an epiphany from it, like I did. :)

38936279.review:
So here I am, sitting and wondering whether this game is any good. RPGMaker is a useful tool which you can use to create interesting games, but the Steam store is flooded with cookie-cutter save-the-world RPGs. I've enjoyed many RPGMaker games, though pretty much all of them were horror games that had little do with actual fighting.

My initial misgivings, understandable as they were, were quickly dashed with clever, witty writing. This is no Shakespeare, don't get me wrong, but any game that gets me to laugh for a minute straight as a result of a well-delivered joke is fine in my book.

This isn't to say the experience is all about going from one joke to another. It's more like a mission to stop evil interspersed with enjoyable banter and serious moments, bolstered by an interesting selection of metal music.

I liked the fact that exploring the world was a reward in itself, not just a way to accrue experience points. I have to admit I've never played a game where the heroes remarked on the stuff they were finding. All too often you find strange objects in other games and no one even bats an eye. This game has spoiled me in this regard.

The battles were ok. They weren't frustrating or anything, and there was a large variety of mooks to defeat, but at the same time it all flew by really fast. Maybe I'm just too used to this. I did, however, like the in-battle dialogues, they spiced things up during the big encounters.

All in all, this game was a pleasant surprise and I've enjoyed every minute of it. I'll be keeping tabs on what the dev cooks up in the future. Perhaps a sequel? The game's lore offers a lot of options.

38900260.review:
Funny RPG game.
Make sure to buy as many +50 mp accessories for all your chars as they can carry, (when you can afford it) as healing is limited (you heal on level up and main guy has it as one of his mp spells) due to no real way to restore mana outside of items (3 towns in havn't seen a way to rest in any fashion)
I enjoyed the old hermit side quest.

38669945.review:
The game has some issues and is hardly perfect, and in terms of RPGMaker games it's fairly basic, but I'd still completely recommend it for a few reasons:

The humor is great and the storyline is amusing.

It's cheap, and definitely woth it's asking price for what it provides.

The game has plenty of flaws, but it'll keep you engaged for around 4~ hours and you'll most likely have a great time, provided that you enjoy Metal music in any shape or form. It has a few references to it here and there, and it has a general 'vibe' that makes it fun to metalheads... And it caters to stoners too, somehow.

I'd rate this one a 7.5/10.

38096288.review:
Every so often, there's an itch that only a retro-style turn-based RPG can scratch, and Metal as Phuk scratches better than one of those hands-on-a-stick things that all our grandmothers have in their house.

Reminiscent of games such as Dragon Quest, Legend of Zelda, and Final Fantasy, Metal as Phuk puts you front and centre as Chael, the last paladin of the Metal Order, on an epic quest to stop three evil bards from summoning A'marthius into the world.

Meet up with some badass compadres to rip evil a dozen new holes, and most importantly, be METAL AS PHUK!

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Metal as Phuk offers a solid 6 hours of playthrough provided you aren't smashing the skip dialogue key, and upon completing the game, you aren't left feeling cheated because frankly it's extremely wallet-friendly.  Its world is full of small details, such as funny notes and Easter eggs.  Each character you encounter has their own dialogue, much of it being absolutely hilarious.

My one criticism of the game is in that some of the dialogue feels a little forced when attempting to be dramatic, similar to an epic B movie from the 80's.  While this is a criticism, it's not actually a detracting factor and actually seems to enhance the experience.  While playing Metal as Phuk, you might experience a feeling similar to, say, watching the original Evil Dead; there is comedy, there is drama, there is an element of horror, but most of all there is a feeling of "god dammit, this kicks ass".

If you are looking for a difficult game, this isn't it (nor is it intended to be).  Metal as Phuk is intended, as the creator notes, to make you laugh.

On a technical note, due to the engine used to develop the game, you cannot change resolution so when you first launch the game it will come up in a small window.  To fix this, hit ALT+Enter, and you're off living the Fullscreen-Fantasy^TM.  You may also want to adjust your volume prior to starting the game, as the music is as loud as it is rockin'.

Overall, this game is a must have.  Buy it now, and thank me when you are sitting back enjoying this bad ass adventure.  Personally, I'm looking forward to seeing more from this developer in the future.

38068945.review:
Metal as Phuk was quite the fun little RPG Maker game. It randomly caught my eye during one of the recent sales and I bought it on a whim.

I think it took me somewhere around 4-5 hours to complete, and I definitely had quite a few chuckles and laughs throughout. You really need to be a fan of various metal bands and the genre in general to pick up on a lot of the jokes, but yeah, it was pretty cool. Depending on how you look at things, the overall lack of difficulty might be a negative, but for me, it was actually ideal, as I wasn't really looking for a challenge with this one. I simply wanted to experience the story, which was fun and irreverent.

In my opinion, Metal as Phuk is one of the better RPG Maker titles you will find on Steam. Try it out (but make sure you know at least a little about metal music or the game won't hold the same level of charm for you most likely).

8 out of 10.

38037293.review:
Another day, another review!   This one was enjoyable however not for the combat.  This game's combat kind of sucked.  You play this game for 2 reasons in particular, the awesome soundtrack, and the incredibly stupid humor.  Both of which are off the walls good in this game.   I haven't laughed this hard in a while (or a few days I laugh a lot), and rocked out when listening to the game music in a while.

However the game's fighting could use a major overhaul, one of the first bosses the abyss worm can easily wipe you if you fight it before going into the well.  Likewise since enemies drop a pittance for money buying enough antidotes (which are fairly expensive early game) to get through the well is pretty difficult.   By end game that's not much of a problem, since the final dungeon is pretty damn short.  However the final boss leaves a lot to be desires, since its a forced loss fight, if he had enough strength that he wiped your team within 3 turns that'd be one thing.  However most of his moves take quite a bit to kill you.  It's made worse by the fact that his only screen nuke (fire breath) is well fire, and all your characters RESIST FIRE!   This is such a dagarn joke when you fight him.  Plus its kind of a rule that you do not have a forced loss final boss unless you have a game that's a direct sequel, but maybe that's just me.

However I think that based on this game they will make a far more enjoyable sequel, and I'm looking forward to playing whatever it is!

38025928.review:
A wonderful and hilarious adventure of epic metal proportions!

Do you like fantasy? Video games? Metal music? Old men who have taken an arrow not to the knee, but to their nether region?

If you replied yes to all of them (really, you like old men who have taken an arrow to their quiver bone??), then this game is perfect for you! If not, then it is still a great game. I enjoyed the music, art and classic RPG feel to this game. It takes me back to when I played games like Breath of Fire and Beyond the Beyond in my childhood. It can be tricky at time, but there is already a great guide on it just in case you're stuck and just want to move along and experience the storyline. The characters are loveable and the jokes are quite crude at times.

In the end, it was a fun game and I would recommend it to my metalhead friends. Well done Crankage Games, I can't wait for your next game to be done!

37941118.review:
[b]Summary:[/b]
If there is one thing the Metal As Phuk has done, it's made me laugh. The adult-like humor found in this game isn't common and in a way it was quite refreshing to experience. But don't let the comedy aspect of the game fool you. CrankageGames definitely put in tons of effort into the lore for the player to discover, even in some of the tiniest overlooked details, and it's system rewards you for discovering it. Worth the buy.

[b]Pro's[/b]
- Considerably cheap game for the amount of content.
- Enjoyable to play
- Rewards you for all types of playthroughs.

[b]Con's[/b]
- Introduce an explanation to the combat phase for those who don't understand turned base.
- There is *a lot* of dialog. All of it unskippable. I'd introduce a feature to completely skip the dialog.

[b]Rating[/b]
3/5

37647817.review:
Fun game with lots of little references and some decent laughs...
Pros:
Funny
Fairly easy
Great drops! [spoiler] Last minute awesome weapons before you fight the final boss if you find two items i shall not mention that are found early on in the game (check everything that might be hiding an item, have a blast!) [/spoiler]
Very speedrunable

Cons:
Short but sweet
Its not necessary to grind out items, i enjoy this aspect of an rpg as it makes me feel more like a completionist [spoiler] You really wana know why? Because its sorta pointless having the best of the best for the last boss battle [/spoiler]
Some of the references could have been a bit extended for more laughs.
Getting enough money for the best buyable items takes quite some time.

I'd rate it a solid 8/10. I wouldn't rate it as excellent, but definitely above average.
Give it a spin, whether full price or discounted its a good way to spend at least a few hours.

Well what can I say about this game....it's a fun turn based RPG with a kick ass sound track! Definitely recommend this game if you enjoy some heavy metal, turn based RPGs & some crude humour! 10/10 would buy again!

The allusions to metal bands & frontmen definitely are worth watching out for (I won't spoil any of them here though!) & I'm sure I missed some myself so another playthrough is in order to see what I may have missed!

35991297.review:
Shortest Version:

TL;DR - BUY THIS PHUKING GAME!


Not So Shortest Version:

I'm a HUGE fan of old school RPGs, so I was SUPER excited to give this game a try! 

My first impressions upon starting this game? The music choices were SOLID, the dialogue was freaking HILARIOUS, and exploration was DEFINTELY encouraged. 

As I am a huge explorer in games, I LOVED the fact I was granted bonus experience by uncovering every nook and cranny.

The characters all had unique and loveable personalities, and I ABSOLUTELY enjoyed the interactions they shared together! 

On top of all the AMAZING things I've already touched base on, the game is filled with so many easter eggs, and great references that will give you a good chuckle. You can REALLY tell the developers put their heart and soul into this game.

Believe me when I tell you this game is unlike ANY OTHER RPG you may have played! And it's available at an INCREDIBLE price! It's LITERALLY a steal for the experience.

I'm already thinking of starting my second play through, just in case I missed any awesomeness the first time around! 

As I stated in the beginning, BUT THIS PHUKING GAME! You will NOT be disappointed.

35301991.review:
Metal as Phuk is a throwback (for me at least) to Gameboy games that were crafted lovingly instead of being shit out to meet a release date. The dialgogue is on point and MaP is one of the few games to make me audibly laugh while playing through it. 

If you've ever played a Final Fantasy game the mechanics of managing a group, using turn based combat, and smart item use should be like second nature.

The mash-up of Metal themes and Anime tropes is a hilarious mixture that I think goes a long way in showing the creators' humor. 

If you want a fun little game to enjoy pick this title up. At $5 I can wholeheartedly say it's worth the price of admission.

35196077.review:
First let me say I'm a bit bias.  Any game that takes on the Metal genre is already a great game.  But now can that great game become something I really love.  I could name a few examples where I expected this to happen but didn't.  I could also name a few that barely where even a bit better than my expectations simply cause it's claims to be a metal type game.  So in this case I'll grade this game in two ways.  One, how it compares to other games in general and two, how it compares in the Metal genre of games.

I did not go into this game with very high expectations.  As stated previously it can't be all that bad after all it's got Metal as a backdrop.  So comparing it against other games in general I'd say it met or overcame my expectations.  The only negative in general thing I have to say about the game overal is the lack of graphical settings but I soon found myself forgetting about that and enjoying the story/gameplay/music/fights/explorations just to name a few things that helped me forget.  I'll mention the others below when comparing it against Metal games.  Seriously, great, funny story telling even if you don't get the Metal references that are a plenty.  The turn based combat is simple to pick up and easy to plan your attacks.  The art work isn't perfect but it sure as hell isn't any where close to the worse I've seen.  Overal I'd leave you with this.  I have a major gaming ADD problem and using a first time out in a game I'm lucky to play an hour.  Next thing I new I was at 2 1/2 hours in this game and it was past my bedtime.

Now to compare it against other Metal games this is one of my top 2 or 3 games.  Hands down the most fun, less stressful, great metal riffs (although I wish it had a bit more to begin with), and helped me totally escape reality.  OH and I laughed so hard at this game.  Any metal head will love the metal references.  They are in your face.

Thanks Crankage Games for a fun game.  I think sometimes developers forget the fun part in gaming but you sure didn't.  I look forward to your next project and hope you keep puting out the fun.

\m/ Peace \m/

35166819.review:
I just bought this game and played my first hour... and I gotta say even tho I don't tend to like RPG maker games...  This p.huking game is P.HUKING AWESOME AS P.HUK!  :-)

It is very cleverly written and made me burst into laugher two or three times in just my first hour of play as well as a few chuckles too.  The last time I played an old school RPG game of this style was way back in like 1996 or so when I bought "Chrono Trigger" for the Super Nintendo!  

Watch this P.huking game P.HUK me up!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gq9W3jt6kvQ

All I gotta say is two things...

1) You're already reading the reviews for this game, so you are thinking about it.. STOP.  ..Just BUY it!  ..It's a really good indie RPG maker game for sure.  

2) When you buy it and play it your first time, Remember to SAVE YOUR GAME OFTEN.  LOL.. I just lost a battle an hour into it and forgot to save my game before my fight like a doofus.  I'm so used to current gen games auto-saving that I completely forgot about how important saving these kinda games is!    Oh well, no biggie because this game is really enjoyable and starting over will just mean more enjoyment!

I'll be back to review this game once I finish it, but so far, loving it.. looks like it's gonna score a minimum of an 8 out of 10. That's not bad at all for a game at this price, especially an RPG.  :-)

33893931.review: I don't play a lot of RPG's but I really enjoy this one. I love the witty dialogue, the unique characters, and of course the word puns. The title is a word pun, how cool is that! 33823271.review:
1st off this game is phuking metal. I wasn't expecting much when I picked this up. I fully expected this to be just another generic rpg maker game, with just some shameless metal pandering tossed around here, and there. I was pleasently wrong about this game.
This is a rpgmaker game, and there are some stock assest used here and there, but surpisingly this game has a decent amount of orginal assests. The soundtrack deserves  a special mention as it is really great, and the dev should consider having it up as a DLC option.

Metal as Phuck has great atmosphere and many moments that will make you think "damn that was phuking metal.'
This game  isn't your standard recruit the character, do their little quest and then forget they even exist, until some plot makes them relevant again  later in the game.Each of the characters have distinct personalities, will give their take on things, and will be very talkative throughout the journey. The banter between chracters reminds me very much of the old Lunar jrpgs. Also just like Lunar most  objects are interactive  rewarding maybe finding items. some character comenting on it or even a  small amount of xp for clicking the random thing. People with OCD beware as you will be clicking up a storm trying find everything.
Plenty of metal references are littered thoughout the game, some are mainstream freindly, with others being a bit obscure that will make you smile if you recognize them.

There are a couple of  negatives though. The battle system is for the most part cookie cutter rpgmaker fare with the standard attack, magic, item etc...options. The game is fairly challenging, but the afortmentioned bare basic battle system doesn't light the world on fire in the excitement category. Metal as Phuk is also on the short side. If you count my idling  you can beat this game in under 5 hours.  In a way that can  be a +  as it is a very entertaining 5 hours, and  Metal as Phuk does not wear out its welcome like a lot of other comedy focused rpgs end up doing.  Closing this review with a hymn made by  some of the great metal prophets of long ago.

"Phuk Made Heavy Metal And He Saw That It Was Good
 Phuk Said To Play It Louder Than Hell
 We Promised That We Would
 When Losers Say It's Over With You Know That It's A Lie
 Phuk Made Heavy Metal And It's Never Gonna Die"
